datafield.subfield: Dedicated to Pena Christova on the occasion of her 70th birthday. Version 2 has minor improvements, added references and a changed affiliation. Version 3 is published in Phys.Part.Nucl. 45 (2014) 3, 529-549 under the title "The ZFITTER project", the references are updated in May 2014. Online at SpringerLink http://link.springer.com/article/10.1134%2FS1063779614030022

The ZFITTER project is aimed at the computation of high-precision theoretical predictions for various observables in high-energy electron-positron annihilation and other processes. The stages of the project development are described. Accent is made on applications to the analysis of LEP data. The present status of the project and perspectives are given as well.
00005 \textit{ The influence of the ${\cal O}(\alpha_s^4)$ QCD corrections \cite{Baikov:2012er} on the $W$ and $Z$ boson widths. }

00000 \textit{ ZFITTER authors: Lida Kalinovskaya, Pena Christova, Dima Bardin, Tord Riemann, Sabine Riemann, Andrej Arbuzov. Photograph made on occasion of 5th Helmholtz International Summer School "Calculations for Modern and Future Colliders", July 23 - August 2, 2012, Dubna, Russia, CALC 2012. Right: Sasha Olshevsky, Arif Akhundov, Mark Jack. \small Fotos: \copyright~ 2012 tordriemann@googlemail.com; JINR, Dubna; A. Akhundov (priv.); Physics at FAMU. }

00004 \textit{ Higgs boson mass measurements. The upper limits and the fit values for $M_H$ derive from a combination of virtual corrections to LEP and similar data, top and $W$ mass measurements, performed by the LEPEWWG. The lower mass limit is due to LEP direct searches. The lower limits from data combinations are not shown. }

00000 \textit{ Left: The first ever plotted LEP observables' dependence on the Higgs mass in the Standard Model (reprinted from Physics Letters, A.~Akhundov, D.~Bardin, and T.~Riemann, ``Hunting the hidden standard Higgs'', volume B166, p. 111, Copyright (1986) \cite{Akhundov:1985cf}, with permission from Elsevier.) Right: Blue-band plot of the LEPEWWG \cite{lepewwg-webpage-jan-2013} with a Standard Model Higgs boson mass prediction based on combined world data from precision electroweak measurements. }

00003 \textit{ Left: $Z$ boson mass measurements at LEP. Earlier measurements are from UA1, UA2 at SPS (CERN) (see text, not shown in plot) and from MARKII at SLC (SLAC). Right: Top quark mass measurements. }

00001 \textit{ Left: The first ever plotted LEP observables' dependence on the Higgs mass in the Standard Model (reprinted from Physics Letters, A.~Akhundov, D.~Bardin, and T.~Riemann, ``Hunting the hidden standard Higgs'', volume B166, p. 111, Copyright (1986) \cite{Akhundov:1985cf}, with permission from Elsevier.) Right: Blue-band plot of the LEPEWWG \cite{lepewwg-webpage-jan-2013} with a Standard Model Higgs boson mass prediction based on combined world data from precision electroweak measurements. }

00002 \textit{ Left: $Z$ boson mass measurements at LEP. Earlier measurements are from UA1, UA2 at SPS (CERN) (see text, not shown in plot) and from MARKII at SLC (SLAC). Right: Top quark mass measurements. }
